body:
upon closer inspection, i'm realizing that pad, unpad, ind_start, ind_end, pad_left, pad_right are also unnecessary ...

so yeah let's alleviate this prototype

issue.title: Simplify `scattering1d`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Fixes #852 and does more :)

This PR removes five input arguments from the core `scattering1d` function while respecting backwards compatibility. 
It will add a few lines of code inside `scattering1d` but will make calls for the 1D core way more lightweight and readable.


Here's how i did it:

```python
pad = backend.pad
unpad = backend.unpad

# compute the padding quantities:
N = x.shape[-1]
N_pad = phi[0].shape[-1]
pad_left, pad_right = compute_padding(N, N_pad)

# compute start and end indices
log2_T = phi["j"]
J = max(max(map(itemgetter("j"), psi1)), max(map(itemgetter("j"), psi2)))
ind_start, ind_end = compute_border_indices(log2_T, J, pad_left, pad_left+N)
```

I only had to modify `compute_padding` so that it takes `N, N_pad` as argument instead of `J_pad,N`. But it's equivalent since`N_pad=2**J_pad`.

This first commit is a fully working example, ready for review. After it's accepted, i'll take care of cleaning up extra keyword arguments from core and call sites (TF/PT/NP frontends) and will confirm the new prototype of `scattering1d` and `compute_padding`

issue.title: avoid passing `log2_T`, `pad`, `unpad` to 1D core

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Fixes #852

a lighter and better focused version of #855

unfortunately the same thing cannot be done in 2D right now because the logic is quite different: `self.pad` is a backend function which is being defined at `build` time and takes `self.shape` as input. It also depends upon a parameter `pre_pad`. It's almost like an object inside the `Scattering2D` object.

Next step for me is to remove `pad_left` and friends and perform padding/unpadding outside of scattering. We've discussed a plan with @MuawizChaudhary for that. (in the spirit of #735 )

issue.title: Remove `out_type` from 1D core, perform formatting in the frontends

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
Address (but does not fully fix)  #852 

Third PR in a streak (after #860 and #861), attempting to simplify core 1D scattering and decouple its functionalities.
This time the offender is `out_type` and the post-processing that comes after the scattering transform per se.

It turns out that there isn't much of a reason to write a backend-agnostic implementation of this formatting stage, considering that it's already divided into `"array"`, `"dict"` and `"list"` cases.

Besides, this PR brings us closer than we've ever been to a `Scattering1D` generator, which would `yield` coefficients instead of `return`-ing them. Hence a _big_ simplification in scope once we're able to decouple `scattering1d` from padding, averaging, and unpadding routines.

issue.title: Move `pad` from `core` to `base_frontend`

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
segue of #877, and moves further in the direction of #855 which closed #852
remove pad from core scattering1d

backwards compatible. opens the door towards custom padding in 1d (#859)
no additional tests
contributes to #735
